newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's Peters invites submissions on pension scheme.
newsitem.headline: NZ's Peters invites submissions on pension scheme.

text.p: The New Zealand government would call for submissions on the design of a compulsory superannuation option, Treasurer Winston Peters said in a statement on Thursday.
He said the deadline for submissions would be May 1.

Peters said the design team, including representatives from the Treasury, Social Welfare, other government departments and the private sector, wanted as much input as possible into the design phase of the compulsory option before submitting a preferred design to the government for its approval.
The approved design would be put to a referendum in September.
The government has promised to be bound by the outcome of the postal referendum whatever the voter turnout.
